candidates.title: Bump rustix from 0.37.23 to 0.37.25

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

candidates.body:
Bumps [rustix](https://github.com/bytecodealliance/rustix) from 0.37.23 to 0.37.25.
Commits
  • 00b84d6 chore: Release rustix version 0.37.25
  • cad15a7 Fixes for Dir on macOS, FreeBSD, and WASI.
  • df3c3a1 Merge pull request from GHSA-c827-hfw6-qwvm
  • b78aeff chore: Release rustix version 0.37.24
  • c0c3f01 Add GNU/Hurd support (#852)
  • f416b6b Fix the test_ttyname_ok test when /dev/stdin is inaccessable. (#821)
  • aee5b09 Downgrade dependencies and disable tests to compile under Rust 1.48.
  • 6d42c38 Disable MIPS in CI. (#793)
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=rustix&package-manager=cargo&previous-version=0.37.23&new-version=0.37.25)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/sourcefrog/cargo-mutants/network/alerts).

candidates.title: Baseline only tests packages that will be mutated
Recurse into return types
candidates.body:
Pretty print generated code using our own method rather than stripping out whitespace.

Fixes #52.

- [x] Actually recurse
- [x] Add some more test cases
- [x] Handle `Option`

candidates.title: Optionally return errors from functions returning Result
candidates.body:
Fixes #118 

- [x] Add option for one or more error return values
- [x] Command line option
- [x] Configuration file option
- [x] Test: a tree with this config option catches missing tests for error handling
- [x] Add `--no-config`
- [x] Test the tree _passes_ with the configuration disabled
- [x] Test the command line option with configuration disabled
- [x] Generate this from functions returning `Result<...>`
- [x] Warn if the error value starts with `Err(`
- [x] Update docs
- [x] Add an error value for cargo-mutants own tree
- [x] ~~Warn if all error values are unviable? (Maybe separately.)~~

candidates.title: More args from env
candidates.body:
- Unify run and run_assert_cmd
- Split out Windows-only tests
- Some options from env
- Add --minimum-test-timeout etc
- Tidy up

candidates.title: cargo update, and update toml tests
candidates.body:
toml 0.7 uses double quotes (or preserves the previous quotes?)
and adds some whitespace, so change to comparing the TOML values 
rather than the strings, which seems to be brittle.

Also, compare paths rather than strings to avoid OS dependencies.

Bump MSRV.

Use indoc to make test data look nicer.

candidates.title: Correctly traverse from src/foo.rs to src/foo/bar.rs
Feat: add exclude files option
candidates.body:
## Description
Added new CLI optional parameter `--exclude` to exclude files and paths, according to [issue](https://github.com/sourcefrog/cargo-mutants/issues/58).

Inspired by the `--file` parameter.

Fixes #58 

## Note
I was not able to debug any of the CLI tests, I wonder if it is normal or if something is off on my machine. 
- Because if it is normal, then maybe we could come up with a better debuggable testing strategy, of course if it is possible in an ergonomic way. It felt quite cumbersome to place print statements everywhere to debug my code when executing CLI tests
- If something needs to be configured to make those tests debuggable, then I feel that we should document it

Let me know what you think about this.

Anyway, it was a great fun to work with the codebase, especially liked this snapshot testing!

candidates.title: Support meta list when checking for attributes
candidates.body:
## 🌟 What is the purpose of this PR?

Currently, only attributes like `#[mutants::skip]` are supported to skip mutation of a function. This implies, that `mutants` needs to be a dependency.

## 🔗 Related links

- Closes https://github.com/sourcefrog/cargo-mutants/issues/34

## 🔍 What does this change?

Support recursive lookup for attributes, so attributes like `#[cfg_attr(test, mutants::skip)]` will be picked up as well. This implies, that `mutants` isn't needed as a dependency but at most a dev-dependency.

## 📜 Does this require a change to the docs?

The README was adjusted to reflect these changes

## ⚠️ Known issues

Attributes are not taken into account currently; only the AST is checked for `mutants::skip`.

## ❓ How to test this?

- Put an attribute like `#[cfg_attr(test, mutants::skip)]` at a function
- Check that this isn't mutated
